intro: Machaerina arfakensis, commonly known as the Arfakensis machaerina, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust stems. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to survive in harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
